title: Ukraine War Drives Volkswagen’s Recovery Off Course
sub_head: The company can cope with losing the Russian market, but the geopolitical crisis may also hit European consumer demand for cars
body:
Volkswagen has more to lose than most global companies from the war in Ukraine.
Chief Executive Herbert Diess said Tuesday the conflict put the German car maker’s outlook for 2022 “into question.” Subject to that caveat, the company expects to sell between 5% and 10% more vehicles this year, following two years of shrinkage due to the pandemic and semiconductor shortage.
